title.rendered: Offroad Animal Scout Roof Rack to suit Toyota Landcruiser 300 Series, Slim line

content.rendered:
Scout Roof Rack to suit Toyota Landcruiser 300 Series, Slim line

Listen up, fellow adventurers! Are you tired of dealing with roof racks for your Land Cruiser that scream like a banshee every time you hit a bump in the road? And don’t even get me started on those generic racks that make your ride look like it’s suffering from an identity crisis. Fear not, my friends! The Offroad Animal rack has come to the rescue! Not only is this bad boy specifically designed to make your ride look like a total babe magnet, but it’s also so quiet you’ll forget it’s even there (unlike your mother-in-law). Say goodbye to noisy racks and hello to envy-inducing jealousy from your mates (and a happy Mrs). Get your hands on an Offroad Animal Scout Rack today and let the good times roll!

 

Benefits

  • Super Quiet design
  • Light weight  aluminium design, 28kg total
  • Very versatile with T-Slot slats, suits standard M8 hardware
  • Looks the best on the market
  • Easy to put together
  • Low profile for better wind resistance  only adds 60mm to height of vehicle
  • Optional wind deflector that holds 42″ LED light bar

Features

  • Supplied with 7 T slot aluminium rails that can quickly and easily fit standard M8 bolts and nuts to secure gear anywhere
  • Works with many aftermarket accessories
  • Optional Wind-deflector can be purchased which integrates a 42″ light bar
  • Powder coated matte black
  • Roof Rated to 150kg dynamic and 350kg Static- Rack weight is 28kg- Offroad Rating is 100kg so minus the 28kg rack means you’re allowed to put 72kg up there off-road and 122kg on road
  • Optional Light bar Wind Deflector holds single or double row light bar up to 42″

Weight:29.25 KG

 

PLEASE NOTE: Depending on stock & availability, the current wait time for this product is approx. 30 – 90 days from date of order. 

CLICK HERE to view the range of products available for your Nissan Patrol!
Follow us on Instagram and Facebook to keep up to date with what’s going on in our workshop!
